text: Get your savings out
when you hear him shout,
any bonds today?
Come on and get them.
During economic crises,

US Treasury bonds are usually
 financial safe havens.
This time...
not so much.

They were right
at the heart of the selloff.

And that pushed up yields
or interest rates

demanded by investors 
to buy government debt.
Yields on 10-year  US Treasuries
skyrocketed 49 basis points in one week.
That's the most in more than two decades.

The bond market had assessed Trump's
tariffs and responded with a message.

We're not sure we're safe
leaving our money in the US anymore.

Now, neither trillions of dollars
of lost value in equity markets,

nor the chorus of alarm from world
leaders had changed Trump's mind.
But angry bond investors?
I was watching the bond market.
The bond market is very tricky.
I was watching it.

That's what got him to press 
pause on his tariffs.
So who are these bond vigilantes?

And why do they play such a significant
role in shaping policy?
